capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's definitely the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're "the one" destined to defeat Voldemort? It's a lot of pressure, but I think Harry handled it pretty well.

I've always been fascinated by Harry's story, you know? He's like a symbol of hope for many people. I mean, who wouldn't want to be "the boy who lived" after all? It's such an iconic title, and it really captures the essence of his journey from being an ordinary kid to becoming a hero in the wizarding world.
